channel.title: In The Can With David And Johnny
channel.description: Your source for behind-the-scenes interviews from the low-budget, independent filmmaking world.
channel.itunes:author: john.bonk@onemandownproductions.com
channel.itunes:subtitle: Your source for behind-the-scenes information about independent filmmaking. Tune in each week for a new discussion about making films on a limited budget with producers and directors that have been there, done that.
channel.itunes:summary: Your source for behind-the-scenes information about independent filmmaking. Tune in each week for a new discussion about making films on a limited budget with producers and directors that have been there, done that.
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site, subject to copyright and fair use.

item.title: In The Can - Episode 38
item.description:
Save the DOG(G)!
http://www.dogthebountyhunter.com/fanclub/Club/FreeTheDog.php

ITC Theme song will be delayed on the PMN till this weekend

http://www.channel101.com/shows/show.php?show_id=152

Johnny makes the big jump!



-Calling Wisconsin filmmakers!

-How we are now recording our Podcast now

-Ultra low budget filmmakers need a VOICE!

-Co-podcast with the DWP www.deadworkers.com (first part was ITC EP31)

-Care & storage of your masters

-The DWP was NOT RESPONSIBLE for the damage to the tape....it was our fault...always monitor your tapes!

http://www.pacificvideorepair.com/

**No it's not an audio flaw....Johnny's beer was overtaking him

-What the white tab on your tapes is REALLY for!

-The far reaching boundaries of your actions

-Lovenotes to Johnny....
item.author: admin@onemandownproductions.com (john.bonk@onemandownproductions.com)

item.title: In The Can - Episode 2.02 Beta
item.description:
A quick update for everyone wondering what the current status of the podcast, as well as our movie "Echoes of the Past".
In this episode, we briefly talk about where we are now, where we are going, and upcoming content!

item.title: In The Can - Episode 31
item.description:
For the first ever Filmmaking Co-Podcast, check out Episode 31 where Johnny and David co-host a Podcast with the Dead Workers Party. We decided to release this like a comic book style cross-over, so we will leave you with a cliffhanger and you will have to head on over to the Dead Workers Party webpage to get the rest of it.

In this episode:

-Johnny and David get interviewed

-Discussions about filming a documentary

-Johnny's Iraq glove story

-Tons of NSFW and NC-17 subjects covered! (Don't listen to this if you are easily offended)


We hope you enjoy the change of pace and make sure you keep checking in on the DWP website for the grand finale of this podcast. Better yet, why don't you subscribe to their feed so you don't miss it!
item.author: admin@onemandownproductions.com (john.bonk@onemandownproductions.com)

item.title: In The Can - Episode 25
item.description:
In this episode, we have an awsome interview with Darrell Hazelrig and his movie, Airband.
Now don't let the title throw you, it is an unbelievable movie with a great story; a damn good story, and really shows what Hollywood can't deliver....an original story with a great cast that leaves you feeling like you've really caught a moment in time.
Both David and I enjoyed this movie and would rate it six stars out of five!The show links will be posted tomorrow, and I'm still polishing the FAQ page so make sure you come back for more info.
Keep in mind that this movie will not be available for the general populace, but OMDP has been able to secure a few SIGNED copies for some lucky listeners! David and I haven't been able to decide what kind of contest we will run for these prizes, but it will definitely be out of the ordinary as we don't want to just give away this movie.
item.author: admin@onemandownproductions.com (john.bonk@onemandownproductions.com)

Both David and I enjoyed this movie and would rate it six stars out of five!The show links will be posted tomorrow, and I'm still polishing the FAQ page so make sure you come back for more info. Keep in mind that this movie will not be available for the general populace, but OMDP has been able to secure a few SIGNED copies for some lucky listeners! David and I haven't been able to decide what kind of contest we will run for these prizes, but it will definitely be out of the ordinary as we don't want to just give away this movie.

item.title: In The Can - Episode 24
item.description:
Well, we're back into the regular swing here at OMDP and David and I covered a lot of ground on this Podcast.

In this Podcast:
-Crappy Movie Moment
-Storyboarding Software
-Problems with releasing a feature length movie
-CYA (Covering Your A$$)
item.author: admin@onemandownproductions.com (john.bonk@onemandownproductions.com)

item.title: In The Can - Episode 23
item.description:
WARNING - Depressing content ahead!
In this episode we cover filmmaking for about five minutes...the rest covers what's been happening behind the scenes here at OMDP. David and I have both had a horrible two weeks here and this is pretty much just a update and a way to get a few things off our chest. Don't worry though, we will be back next week, back on topic, and with more filmmaking info.
item.author: admin@onemandownproductions.com (john.bonk@onemandownproductions.com)

item.title: In The Can - Episode 17
item.description:
Hey folks.....you asked for it, and now we've got it!

Check out this week's episode for the first part of our interview with Brian Williamson on his animated, feature length, low-budget movie entitled "DragonWars". Brian came to the table with many tips for how to do effects on the cheap, types of hardware to focus on, and what software works and what doesn't. Even if you're a live action filmmaker, you'll want to check this one out!
item.author: admin@onemandownproductions.com (john.bonk@onemandownproductions.com)

item.title: In The Can - Episode 15
item.description: In this episode David and Johnny interview the Dead Workers Party to discuss how they plan to shoot their behind the scenes documentary on their upcoming music video shootout. The interview ran much longer than anticipated, so this has been split into two sections. Check back next Tuesday for the rest of the interview. Tons of tips, tons of jokes and tons of.....well, you'll find out.

item.title: In The Can - Episode 14
item.description:
In this episode we talk about important ways to keep your crew motivated, upcoming film festivals, and a rather long rant by Johnny about some comments from "The Dude"

Audio quality on this podcast is well below average due to a glitch with the recording software. Luckily we we alway record with a backup unit, so we hope you'll enjoy the podcast even with the slightly degraded quality.
